did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Custodia de San Carlos de Sonora 1788
did.abstract: Forty-page holographic manuscript; relates the history and description of the Franciscan custody of San Carlos, Sonora, Mexico. Written at the Aconchi Mission, and dated July 11, 1788. This was a new administrative district that would institute reforms in the Sonoran mission communities.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no restrictions on this collection.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Custodia de San Carlos de Sonora (MS 143). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Franciscan priest; Father President of the Sonoran missions, 1781-1783; headed the ecclesiastical counteroffensive to Bishop Antonio de los Reyes' plan for the San Carlos "custodia." This was a new administrative district that would institute reforms in the Sonoran mission communities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Forty-page holographic manuscript; relates the history and description of the Franciscan custody of San Carlos, Sonora, Mexico. Written at the Aconchi Mission, and dated July 11, 1788.
